sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: An overwhelming number of frameworks and tooling available today gives the impression that web development has gotten perhaps too complex. Juan Diego Rodríguez explores if web development really is that complex and, most importantly, how we can prevent it from getting even more difficult than we already perceive it to be.
articles.title: Web Development Is Getting Too Complex, And It May Be Our Fault

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: With one billion people aged 60 or older worldwide, inclusivity is more important than ever. Learn how to create digital experiences that empower independence and competence for older adults while enhancing usability for all. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: A Guide To Designing For Older Adults

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Maximillian Piras)
articles.description: As Artificial Intelligence evolves the computing paradigm, designers have an opportunity to craft more intuitive user interfaces. Maximillian Piras examines how the latest AI capabilities can reshape the future of human-computer interaction beyond conversation alone.
articles.title: When Words Cannot Describe: Designing For AI Beyond Conversational Interfaces

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: With February just around the corner, how about a little inspiration boost? We might have one for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Enjoy!
articles.title: 29 Days Of Inspiration (February 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: Most product teams commonly adopt a feature-centric mindset, finding them convenient for brainstorming, drafting requirement documents, and integrating into backlogs and ticketing systems. In this article, Andy Budd shows how fixation with features might be holding you back and how making a few small tweaks to your process could make an entire world of difference.
articles.title: The Feature Trap: Why Feature Centricity Is Harming Your Product

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Language models have shown impressive capabilities. But that doesn’t mean they’re without faults, as anyone who has witnessed a ChatGPT “hallucination” can attest. In this article, Joas Pambou diagnoses the symptoms that cause hallucinations and explains not only what RAG is but also different approaches for using it to solve language model limitations.
articles.title: A Simple Guide To Retrieval Augmented Generation Language Models

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yair Even Or)
articles.description: Taking inspiration from shadows, author Yair Even Or creates the same sort of thing, only with a blurring effect in place of the shadow. Read along for a step-by-step explanation of how it comes together using a combination of masks, gradients, and the good ol’ `backdrop-filter` property.
articles.title: CSS Blurry Shimmer Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Filip Paldia & Jamie Clarke)
articles.description: AI promises a major upheaval in typography, with designers finding themselves navigating both opportunities and challenges. How will it impact quality, design roles, and our use of type in the future? As we explore this new frontier, we realise that we are at a juncture as significant as Gutenberg’s press, set to redefine how we interact with text and visual communication.
articles.title: The AI Dilemma In Graphic Design: Steering Towards Excellence In Typography And Beyond

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023

articles.author: Sahil Mahapatra
articles.description: Destructuring is a powerful JavaScript feature introduced in ES6 (ECMAScript 2015). It makes it easier to extract values from arrays or properties from objects and assign them to variables in a readable way.  Let's delve into how destructuring works and explore various use cases with examples. You can get
articles.title: How Destructuring Works in JavaScript – Explained with Code Examples

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: useMemo is a valuable tool in the React framework, designed to optimize performance by memoizing expensive computations.  With useMemo, React can store the result of a function call and reuse it when the dependencies of that function haven't changed, rather than recalculating the value on every render.  useMemo
articles.title: How to Work with useMemo in React – with Code Examples

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: There are many people who want to change careers to become a software developer but don't know what the optimal path is. There are many challenges and uncertainties that accompany such a significant change. We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that is a guide for those
articles.title: Career Change to Code Guide

articles.author: Kamaldeen Lawal
articles.description: In JavaScript, developers need to be able to dynamically update a page without replacing the entire content. A traditional method like innerHTML can cause performance issues, because these methods tend to replace the entire content of an element. The insertAdjacentHTML() method leads to better performance because you use it to
articles.title: How to Use the JavaScript insertAdjacentHTML() method for Efficient DOM Manipulation

articles.author: Kedar Makode
articles.description: Efficient storage management is a crucial aspect of maintaining a well-organized computing environment.  In this detailed guide, we'll explore the features of Master Boot Record (MBR) disk partitioning using the parted command on Linux.  Additionally, we'll cover the process of adding a new hard disk in VMware, as
articles.title: How Master Boot Record Disk Partitioning Works in Linux

articles.author: Kunal Nalawade
articles.description: Hello everyone! It's good to be back with another tutorial – this time on Java, one of the most popular programming languages out there today.  Java is used by developers and enterprises to build powerful applications that serve many different purposes. The object-oriented nature of Java makes writing clean,
articles.title: Java Project – How to Build a Simple Parking Lot Management System

articles.author: Vahe Aslanyan
articles.description: In this handbook, you'll learn how to build your personal brand as a developer to help you make your mark in the tech industry.  With a focus on practicality and professionalism, this guide is designed for developers at all levels, from industry veterans to those just starting their coding
articles.title: Personal Branding for Developers – A Step by Step Handbook

articles.author: Jess Wilk
articles.description: If you want to learn how to navigate the ever-evolving job market by scraping job posting sites like Indeed.com, then this guide is for you.  What is a Job Scraper? In the digital age, tools known as Job Board Scrapers (or just Job Scrapers) have become indispensable for people
articles.title: How to Build a Job Board Scraper with Python

articles.author: Gavin Lon
articles.description: C# version 1 was released in January 2002. It is a modern, general purpose programming language designed and developed from the ground up by the renowned Danish software engineer, Anders Heijleberg and his team at Microsoft.  I’ve heard Anders Heijlsberg say in an interview that with C# the goal
articles.title: Learn the C# Programming Language – Full Book for Beginners

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: React is one of the most popular frontend JavaScript frameworks.  We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to build twenty-five different projects using React. Each project is designed to challenge and enhance your understanding of React's capabilities. Sangam Mukherjee developed this
articles.title: Master React by Building 25 Projects

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: By mastering Spring Boot and Spring Data JPA, you'll be equipped to build efficient, scalable, and secure applications with ease, making you a valuable asset in the job market and a more effective developer. We just published a comprehensive video course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that teaches Spring Boot
articles.title: Learn Spring Boot and Spring Data JPA

articles.author: Benjamin Semah
articles.description: If you are a JavaScript developer, you may come across the string "use strict" at the top of your JavaScript code. This means that JavaScript's strict mode is in use. But what does this mean, and why does it matter? In this article, you'll learn what it means to write
articles.title: What is Strict Mode in JavaScript? Explained with Examples

articles.author: Sahil Mahapatra
articles.description: Understanding Vim key bindings is crucial for navigating and editing text efficiently in Vim or Vim-based text editors like Neovim.  In this article, we'll explore the most common Vim key bindings that will help you navigate your text editor seamlessly. Table of Content  * Vim Modes  *
articles.title: Vim Key Bindings – Vim Keys List Reference

articles.author: Daniel Adetunji
articles.description: ACID (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and Durability) is a set of guarantees when working with a DBMS. Pessimistic and optimistic concurrency control explains how databases achieve the “I” in ACID. Isolation is a guarantee that concurrently running transactions should not interfere with each other. This is arguably the most important ACID
articles.title: How Databases Guarantee Isolation – Pessimistic vs Optimistic Concurrency Control Explained

articles.author: Timothy Olanrewaju
articles.description: State management is a crucial concept in React, which is one of the most popular JavaScript libraries in the world for building dynamic user interfaces.  Due to its importance in handling data, it is essential know how to manage state, when you need them, and where they can be
articles.title: State Management in React – When and Where to use State

articles.author: Okure U. Edet
articles.description: If you are reading this article, you are probably a developer who has used an API to call data for your application. You may have also used features such as filtering and pagination to limit the amount of data you want to receive.  These API features are important when
articles.title: How to Add Filtering, Sorting, Limiting, and Pagination to Your Nest.js App

articles.author: Jessica Wilkins
articles.description: In CSS, there is a property called box-sizing that allows you to determine how the width and the height for an element is calculated.  A lot of CSS resets [/news/how-i-style-my-websites-with-my-favorite-css-resets-7ace41dbc43d/] will change the default box model from content-box to border-box to make the layouts easier to work with. But
articles.title: What is box-sizing: border-box in CSS?

articles.author: Clinton Joy
articles.description: Javascript has become a very popular programming language thanks to its growing use in frontend and backend development.  And as devs build JavaScript applications for different companies and organizations, the size and complexity of these applications can pose interesting performance challenges. As developers, we seek to create applications that
articles.title: Immutable JavaScript – How to Improve the Performance of Your JS Applications

articles.author: Okoro Emmanuel Nzube
articles.description: React is an open-source JavaScript library that helps you build dynamic user interfaces (UIs). You can use it to build components that represent logically reusable parts of the UI. Because React is open source, anyone can access its source code, inspect it, modify it, and enhance it for their personal
articles.title: How to Install React – A Step-by-Step Guide

articles.author: Abraham Dahunsi
articles.description: Observability refers to our ability to "see" and understand what's happening inside a system by looking at its external signals (like logs, metrics, and traces). Observability involves collecting and analyzing data from sources within a system to monitor its performance and address problems effectively. Why is Observability Useful?  1.
articles.title: How to Use OpenTelementry to Trace Node.js Applications

articles.author: Reed Barger
articles.description: If you're building applications with React, you should learn how to use some helpful libraries that'll make it easier to add the features you need. For example, to add features like authentication or styling, you'll need to find a good third-party library to handle it. In this comprehensive guide, I'm
articles.title: React Libraries to Use in Your Projects in 2024

articles.author: Silvia
articles.description: Udazken eta negu hasierako burujabetza teknologikoa sustatzeko tailer eta ekimen sortei jarraipena emanez, TEKS elkarteak eta Errenteriako Udalak elkarlanean neguaren bigarren erdi honetan ere saio gehiago antolatu ditugu. Zentzu horretan, Teknologia Denontzat ildoko tailerrei indarra emango diegu, eta teknologiak gure gizartean sortzen duen ezagutza arrakala txikitu, eta teknologiaren erabilera zuzena herritar guztien eskura egon dadin […]
articles.title: Neguko tailerrak Torrekuan

articles.author: Silvia
articles.description: Eguberrien bueltan, Gabonetan, Torrekuako Tailerrak egingo ditugu Orereta-Errenteriako Torrekuan. Teknologia izango da gaiaren muina, mugikor eta ordenagailuen erabilera, scratch programazioa eta pasahitzak, besteak beste. Abenduaren 26an eta 27an, 10:00etatik 13:00etara bitarte, ‘Scratch programazioa familian’ eskainiko dugu. Tailer honetan, haurrek, pertsona heldu batekin batera, programazioaren hastapenak ikasi ahal izango dituzte. Bertaratzeko, ez da programazioaren inguruko aurre ezagutza berezirik beharko. […]
articles.title: Torrekuako Tailerrak Gabonetan
